title: Disphenoid
summary: In geometry, a disphenoid (from Greek  sphenoeidesÂ 'wedgelike') is a tetrahedron whose four faces are congruent acute-angled triangles.[1] It can also be described as a tetrahedron in which every two edges that are opposite each other have equal lengths. Other names for the same shape are isotetrahedron,[2] sphenoid,[3] bisphenoid,[3] isosceles tetrahedron,[4] equifacial tetrahedron,[5]  almost regular tetrahedron,[6] and tetramonohedron.[7]
